articles.author: Philip Blenkinsop
articles.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said on Thursday the EU had received the "latest U.S. document" for further negotiations on tariffs but did not reveal details of Washington's demands.
articles.title: EU received 'latest' trade proposal from US, von der Leyen says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said on Thursday the EU should do a "quick and simple" trade deal with the United States rather than a "slow and complicated" one.
articles.title: Germany's Merz urges 'quick and simple' EU-US trade deal

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Colombia's Constitutional Court on Thursday halted an electoral court's investigation into President Gustavo Petro.
articles.title: Colombia's constitutional court halts electoral court's investigation into President Petro

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. House Judiciary Committee sent a subpoena to Harvard University on Thursday seeking documents and communications for its probe into tuition costs and financial aid for Ivy League students.
articles.title: US House committee subpoenas Harvard over tuition costs

articles.author: Nandita Bose, David Lawder
articles.description: The United States has reached an understanding with China on how to expedite rare earth shipments to the U.S., a White House official said on Thursday, amid efforts to end a trade war between the world's biggest economies.
articles.title: US says deal with Beijing will expedite rare earth exports from China

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Susan Heavey
articles.description: U.S. Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth on Thursday said he was unaware of any intelligence suggesting Iran had moved any of its highly enriched uranium to shield it from U.S. strikes on Iran's nuclear program over the weekend.
articles.title: No known intelligence that Iran moved uranium, US defense chief says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli gunfire and airstrikes killed at least 21 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip on Thursday, local health authorities said, as mediators reached out to Israel and Hamas to seek a resumption of ceasefire talks to end the war.
articles.title: Israeli attacks kill at least 21 people in Gaza, medics say

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: For U.S. President Donald Trump, Vladimir Putin is a man looking for an off-ramp to his bloody three-year assault on Ukraine.
articles.title: Following NATO summit, Trump and Europe still at odds over Putin's ambitions

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran would respond to any future U.S. attack by striking American military bases in the Middle East, Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Thursday, in his first televised remarks since a ceasefire was reached between Iran and Israel.
articles.title: Supreme leader, in first appearance since ceasefire, says Iran would strike back if attacked

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: EU leaders agreed on Thursday to renew sanctions imposed against Russia over Moscow's war in Ukraine for another six months, two EU officials said.
articles.title: EU leaders agree to renew Russia sanctions for another six months
